column7: Introduction to the complex relationship between people and the natural environment from a social science perspective. Explores different approaches to environmental issues, and examines the role of population change, political economy, technologies, environmental policymaking, and social institutions in causing and resolving contemporary social and environmental global issues. Same as ESE 210.
column10: Grand Challenge-Inequality, and Social & Beh Sci - Soc Sci course.
column11: This course is generally offered in-person for the full 16-week fall and spring terms, and an 8-week online asynchronous version is offered during the Summer. The department offered the 8-week version temporarily during the pandemic.
